title: Chilling Facebook post left before murder-suicide
content:
SULPHUR, LA (KPLC) -
A 4-year-old boy was killed in a murder-suicide in Sulphur Sunday night, authorities said.
The investigation is in the preliminary stages but it appears Kenneth Bacque’ Jr., 59, shot his son and then shot himself, said Kim Myers, Calcasieu Parish Sheriff's Office spokeswoman.
Sheriff's Office deputies responded to a home on Dahlia Lane around 10:30 p.m Sunday following reports that Bacque' had posted on Facebook that he was going to kill himself and possibly harm his 4-year-old son, Myers said.
In the note, which has since been taken down, Bacque claimed to be going through family troubles. He referenced a George Strait song called 'Today My World Slipped Away' as well as saying that he and his son were 'going home'. The note ended with the chilling phrase, "Call 911 & Coroner."
Arriving deputies were unable to contact Bacque' and upon forcing entry into the home, found Bacque' and his son in a bedroom dead from apparent gunshot wounds.
Detective Casey Lafargue is the lead investigator.
